addChangeColoringHeteroatomMethodListener

(
  • String|null
  • Object
)

Defined in pv\ProteinVisualisator.js:2126

Function to add handler for changing coloring method of hetero atoms. If first argument is null, this function also creates radio buttons for coloring methods. Options object should have structure like this: options = {}

Parameters:

  • String|null Object

    coloringPanel id of DOM element containing radio buttons for coloring methods. If it is null, function creates radio buttons using second parameter.

  • Object Object

    options object containing parameters to create coloring methods radio buttons.

Returns:

ProteinVisualisator Function returns ProteinVisualisator object.

addChangeColoringMethodListener

(
  • String|null
  • Object
)

Defined in pv\ProteinVisualisator.js:2040

Function to add handler for changing coloring method of protein atoms. If first argument is null, this function also creates select options for coloring methods. Options object should have structure like this: options = { parent: 'parent_selector', div: {id:'div_id',class:'div_class'}, select: { id: 'select_id', class: 'select_class' }, options: { BY_ATOMS: {render: true|false, id: '', class: '', selected: true|false, text:'label_text'}, BY_SPECTRUM: {render: true|false, id: '', class: '', selected: true|false, text:'label_text'}, BY_POLARITY: {render: true|false, id: '', class: '', selected: true|false, text:'label_text'}, BY_CHAINS: {render: true|false, id: '', class: '', selected: true|false, text:'label_text'}, BY_SEC_STRUCT: {render: true|false, id: '', class: '', selected: true|false, text:'label_text'}, } }

Parameters:

  • String|null Object

    coloringPanel id of DOM element containing radio buttons for coloring methods. If it is null, function creates radio buttons using second parameter.

  • Object Object

    options object containing parameters to create coloring methods radio buttons.

Returns:

ProteinVisualisator Function returns ProteinVisualisator object.

addChangeHeteroatomVisualisationMethodListener

(
  • String|null
  • Object
)

Defined in pv\ProteinVisualisator.js:2086

Function to add handler for changing visualisation method of hetero atoms. If first argument is null, this function also creates radio buttons for visualisation methods. Options object should have structure like this: options = { parent: 'parent_selector', div: {id:'div_id',class:'div_class'}, options: { BALL_AND_STICK: {render: true|false, checked: true|false, label: {id:'',class:'',text:'label_text'}, input: {id:'',class:'',name:'input_name'}}, ATOM: {render: true|false, checked: true|false, label: {id:'',class:'',text:'label_text'}, input: {id:'',class:'',name:'input_name'}}, STICK: {render: true|false, checked: true|false, label: {id:'',class:'',text:'label_text'}, input: {id:'',class:'',name:'input_name'}} } }

Parameters:

  • String|null Object

    heteroatomMethodPanel id of DOM element containing radio buttons for visualisation methods. If it is null, function creates radio buttons using second parameter.

  • Object Object

    options object containing parameters to create visualisation methods radio buttons.

Returns:

ProteinVisualisator Function returns ProteinVisualisator object.

(
  • String|null
  • Object
)

Defined in pv\ProteinVisualisator.js:2299

Function to add handler for changing visualisation method of side chain atoms. If first argument is null, this function also creates radio buttons for visualisation methods. Options object should have structure like this: options = { parent: 'parent_selector', div: {id:'div_id',class:'div_class'}, options: { BALL_AND_STICK: {render: true|false, checked: true|false, label: {id:'',class:'',text:'label_text'}, input: {id:'',class:'',name:'input_name'}}, STICK: {render: true|false, checked: true|false, label: {id:'',class:'',text:'label_text'}, input: {id:'',class:'',name:'input_name'}} } }

Parameters:

  • String|null Object

    sideChainMethodPanel id of DOM element containing radio buttons for visualisation methods. If it is null, function creates radio buttons using second parameter.

  • Object Object

    options object containing parameters to create visualisation methods radio buttons.

Returns:

ProteinVisualisator Function returns ProteinVisualisator object.

addChangeVisualisationMethodListener

(
  • String|null
  • Object
)

Defined in pv\ProteinVisualisator.js:1998

Function to add handler for changing visualisation method of protein atoms. If first argument is null, this function also creates radio buttons for visualiosation methods. Options object should have structure like this: options = { parent: 'parent_selector', div: {id:'div_id',class:'div_class'}, options: { BALL_AND_STICK: {render: true|false, checked: true|false, label: {id:'',class:'',text:'label_text'}, input: {id:'',class:'',name:'input_name'}}, ATOM: {render: true|false, checked: true|false, label: {id:'',class:'',text:'label_text'}, input: {id:'',class:'',name:'input_name'}}, SECENDARY_STRUCT: {render: true|false, checked: true|false, label: {id:'',class:'',text:'label_text'}, input: {id:'',class:'',name:'input_name'}}, SECENDARY_STRUCT_THIN: {render: true|false, checked: true|false, label: {id:'',class:'',text:'label_text'}, input: {id:'',class:'',name:'input_name'}}, SECENDARY_STRUCT_CYLINDER: {render: true|false, checked: true|false, label: {id:'',class:'',text:'label_text'}, input: {id:'',class:'',name:'input_name'}} } }

Parameters:

  • String|null Object

    methodPanel id of DOM element containing radio buttons for visualisation methods. If it is null, function creates radio buttons using second parameter.

  • Object Object

    options object containing parameters to create visualisation methods radio buttons.

Returns:

ProteinVisualisator Function returns ProteinVisualisator object.

addLoadFilePanel

(
  • String|null
  • Object
)

Defined in pv\ProteinVisualisator.js:2452

Function to add event to handle load file from user local files. If first argument is null, this function also creates load file html element. Options object should have structure like this: options = { parent: 'parent_selector', div: {id:'',class:''}, file: { id: 'file_id', class: '', name: 'file_name' } }

Parameters:

  • String|null Object

    filePanel id for html file element, if null this element will be created.

  • Object Object

    options attributes used to create html file element.

Returns:

ProteinVisualisator Function returns ProteinVisualisator object.

addShowingHeteroatomListener

(
  • String|null
  • Object
)

Defined in pv\ProteinVisualisator.js:2155

Function to add handler for show and hide hetero atoms checkbox. If first argument is null, this function also creates this checkbox. Options object should have structure like this: options = { parent: 'parent_selector', div: {id:'div_id',class:'div_class'}, render: true, label: {id:'',class:'',text:'label_text'}, input: {id:'input_id',class:'',name:'input_name'} }

Parameters:

  • String|null Object

    showHeteroatom id of DOM element containing show/hide checkbox. If it is null, function creates this checkbox.

  • Object Object

    options object containing parameters to create show/hide checkbox.

Returns:

ProteinVisualisator Function returns ProteinVisualisator object.

Parameters:

  • String|null Object

    showSideChain id of DOM element containing show/hide checkbox. If it is null, function creates this checkbox.

catmullRomSubdivide

(
  • Array
  • Integer
)
private

Defined in pv\ProteinVisualisator.js:1237

Function implementing Catmull-Rom subdivide algorithm. This algorithm is used to compute Control Points to draw spline on given points. Catmull-Rom subdivide algorithm is described eg. on page: http://www.mvps.org/directx/articles/catmull/

Parameters:

  • Array Object

    pointsList array of Atom.pos objects

  • Integer Object

    segmentsNum number of Control Points computed between two given points

Returns:

Array Function returns array of Control Points

checkBond

(
  • Atom
  • Atom
)
private

Defined in pv\ProteinVisualisator.js:465

Function to check if two atoms are connected. It sometimes happend then PDB files do not contain informations about connections between atoms, so such information must be getting in other way.

Parameters:

  • Atom Object

    atom1 object of Atom class

  • Atom Object

    atom2 object of Atom class

Returns:

Integer Function returns 0 when atoms are not connected or 1 when they are

clearModel

()

Defined in pv\ProteinVisualisator.js:1986

Function clear protein model. Removes protein data containing in ProteinVisualisator class.

createShowButtonControl

(
  • String
  • Object
)

Defined in pv\ProteinVisualisator.js:2375

Function to create show/hide DOM checkbox for part of model specify by first argument. Options object should have structure like this: options = { parent: 'parent_selector', div: {id:'div_id',class:'div_class'}, render: true, label: {id:'',class:'',text:'label_text'}, input: {id:'input_id',class:'',name:'input_name'} }

Parameters:

  • String Object

    part name of model's part which should be showing/hiding by this checkbox.

  • Object Object

    options object containing parameters to create show/hide checkbox.

Returns:

String id of created DOM element

createVisualisationMethodControl

(
  • String
  • Object
)

Defined in pv\ProteinVisualisator.js:2398

Function to create visualisation method DOM radio buttons for part of model specify by first argument. Options object should have structure like this specified for part for which control panel should be created.

Parameters:

  • String Object

    part name of model's part which should be controlled by created panel.

  • Object Object

    options object containing parameters to create control panel.

Returns:

String id of created DOM element

Function to get square distance between two atoms.

Parameters:

  • Object X:posX,y:posY,z:posZ

    atom1pos object containing position of first atom in format:

  • Object X:posX,y:posY,z:posZ

    atom2pos object containing position of second atom in format:

Returns:

Float Function returns square distance between two atoms

Parameters:

init

(
  • String
  • Object
)

Defined in pv\ProteinVisualisator.js:1960

Function to initialise ProteinVisualisator library object. It calls ProteinVisualisator constructor, check dependencies, initialise resize event handler and create ThreeJS objects such as scene, camera, lights, renderer, controls.

Parameters:

  • String Object

    parentSelector html selector to element where ThreeJS renderer should be initialised.

  • Object Object

    attr object containing some of attributes for canvas element, such as: name, id, class

Returns:

ProteinVisualisator Function returns ProteinVisualisator object.

parsePDBFile

(
  • String
)
private

Defined in pv\ProteinVisualisator.js:296

Function to parse data in PDB format. PDB format structure is described eg. on page: http://www.wwpdb.org/documentation/file-format-content/format33/v3.3.html

Parameters:

  • String Object

    data String object containing data from loaded file

Returns:

Promise Function returns Promise object cantaining object with data from pdb file divided into properties: info - information about in file, atoms - object containing Atom objects, sheets - object containing Sheet objects, helixes - object containing Helix objects, turns - object containing Turn objects, subunits - object containing subunit objects

render

() private

Defined in pv\ProteinVisualisator.js:1690

Function to render scene. It also return render time on javascript console.

render

(
  • Object
)

Defined in pv\ProteinVisualisator.js:2485

Function to start rendering model. If any options passed it overwrites default ones.

Parameters:

  • Object Object

    options custom render options, like width and height of canvas.

Returns:

ProteinVisualisator Function returns ProteinVisualisator object.
